creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
Looks like a possible RFC 2616 MUST violation.
Vary response header does not cause invalidation
when 2nd request headers mismatch original request
headers. This is a pretty nasty bug since Vary is often
used for server-driven negotiation.

See attached traces for details and ways to reproduce
some of the violations mentioned above.

Test case IDs in the trace link to human-oriented test case
description and RFC quotes, if available.

creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
We would be happy to re-test if
somebody is making related fixes.

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text: I believe this has been fixed by in both trunk and 2.0.54, can you please test it?

creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
Created attachment 15296
fresh Vary: * trace

There is partial progress with this violation.

httpd-2.0.54 honors specific Vary headers
but there is still a violation for the
Vary: * case. A fresh trace is attached.

Note that when Vary: * is given, even an
identical request must cause revalidation.

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
In the Vary: * case, should we even bother caching the request?

Perhaps with Vary:* mod_cache should just DECLINE.

Thoughts?

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
Created attachment 15297
do not cache any replies that contain vary:*

Attached is a patch for 2.0.x that has mod_cache DECLINE any requests that
contain Vary:*.

I believe this should fix this RFC violation.

Patched httpd-2.0.54 passes all test cases
related to Vary revalidation. Thank you.

I did not change the bug status to FIXED
because I do not know whether the patch
needs to be commited to CVS first.
creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
